text: Weston is a town in Fairfield County, Connecticut. The population was 10,354 at the 2020 census. As of 2008, about 19% of the town's workforce travels to New York City for work. Like many towns in southwestern Connecticut, Weston is one of the richest communities in the United States. In 2022 the median household income was US$220,754. Most of Devil's Den Preserve is in the town. It is a nature reserve which gets 40,000 visits a year. ==References== Category:Towns in Fairfield County, Connecticut Category:1787 establishments in the United States Category:1780s establishments in Connecticut
title: Weston, Connecticut
